title: Are Princess Eugenie and her husband Jack Brooksbank going to make an announcement?
text:
Has Princess Eugenie been waiting generously for her sister Beatrice to reveal her engagement to Edoardo Mapelli Mozzi before making an announcement of her own?

Whispers reach me that, almost a year after their wedding, Eugenie and her husband Jack Brooksbank are ready to start a family but haven’t talked about it because of a genuine wish not to upstage Bea.

In the Royal Family, timing is everything. Eugenie had to wait to marry Jack until after her cousin Prince Harry had tied the knot.

Has Princess Eugenie been waiting for her sister Beatrice to reveal her engagement to Edoardo Mapelli Mozzi before making an announcement of her own? Whispers reach me that, almost a year after their wedding, Eugenie and her husband Jack Brooksbank (pictured) are ready to start a family but haven’t talked about it because of a genuine wish not to upstage Bea

The announcement of Bea and property tycoon Edo's engagement was made on September 26

Alas, Eugenie’s big day was reportedly overshadowed when Harry and Meghan revealed to some family and friends at the nuptials that they were expecting their first child.

This might explain why Beatrice’s engagement news was timed – or should I say mistimed – at the beginning of Harry and Meghan’s African tour.

Well, they do say revenge is a dish best served cold…

Eugenie’s big day was reportedly overshadowed when Harry and Meghan revealed to some family and friends at the nuptials that they were expecting their first child

DUP leader Arlene Foster was far from offended when radio presenter Julia Hartley-Brewer confused her with former Strictly judge Arlene Phillips.

‘I like being called Arlene Phillips and I’d love to have her body,’ the Ulster politician told me in Manchester last week.

DUP leader Arlene Foster was far from offended when radio presenter Julia Hartley-Brewer confused her with former Strictly judge Arlene Phillips.

‘There aren’t enough Arlenes in public life.’

I’m just praying no one asks Ms Phillips to settle the Irish border problem.

The Royals open everything from hospitals to bridges, but the Duchess of Cambridge broke new ground recently – by opening a Pret a Manger sandwich.

My pals at London’s V&A museum say Kate had an official lunch there, but insisted there should be no fuss and happily joined staff for a takeaway meal.
description: Whispers reach me that Eugenie and her husband are ready to start a family but haven't talked about it because of a genuine wish not to upstage Bea, writes CHARLOTTE GRIFFITHS.
authors: Charlotte Griffiths For The Mail On Sunday
